LEAVING: Albert Einstein; Nikola Tesla; Robin Williams
MERGING: Marilyn Monroe; Oprah Winfrey; Bill Clinton
ENDURING: Eeyore in Winnie the Pooh; Samwise Gamgee in Lord of the Rings
AGGRESSIVE: Jack Nicholson; Tom Cruise; Voldemort; most heroes and villains

LEAVING: can experience unitive essence; fears individuated essence
MERGING: experiences individuated essence as not enough
ENDURING: individuated essence is not protected from others
AGGRESSIVE: has individuated essence, but fears it is bad or evil
RIGID: does not experience individuated essence; believes it doesn't exist

LEAVING: to individuate; to decide to live as a human in a physical body
MERGING: to nurture self; to know self is enough
ENDURING: to claim own space and the safety to express self
AGGRESSIVE: to trust others; to have needs and still be safe
RIGID: to feel real self; trust it, express it, and act from it

MERGING: to experience the infinite source within
ENDURING: to recognize individuated essence as valid and divine
AGGRESSIVE: to feel held by a bigger, stronger, loving presence
RIGID: to experience both unitive and individuated essence within

LEAVING: embodying spirit in the physical world
ENDURING: owning lots of space, expressing self, taking action
AGGRESSIVE: letting go in a safe place

column1: How to get yourself out of pattern
LEAVING: re-enter your body; reference your core and ground; reassemble your self
MERGING: find your core and reference it; act from there
ENDURING: move your body; claim your space and fill it
AGGRESSIVE: ground yourself; allow something good and bigger than you to contain you
RIGID: focus on feelings and sensations as your guidance

LEAVING: believes resource/ support went away (but actually, their attention went away)
MERGING: avoids direct requests; references others for answers; waits for rescue
ENDURING: asks, then devalues what is offered, because they want to find it on their own
AGGRESSIVE: rarely asks for help; demands or commands instead
references only self and answers accordingly
RIGID: whatever the rules dictate; wants to help

LEAVING: psychic attack; white hot rage about unmet needs
MERGING: little direct anger; resentment at having to grow up
ENDURING: spiteful; no longer cares; can now act on all those boundary violations
AGGRESSIVE: an explosion; venting the terror while denying that it is terror
RIGID: righteousness; sharp words, usually about rule violations

column1: Weapons and tactics used in a fight
ENDURING: hunkering down and enduring; not responding; passive aggression; baiting
AGGRESSIVE: active aggression, bullying and intimidation; blunt force
RIGID: sharp, piercing words: sarcasm; blaming; condemning

LEAVING: use a light touch, be soft and warm; note their beauty, fun, creativity, originality
MERGING: make it personal and emotional; speak to their heart; tell them you love what they did
ENDURING: don't invade their space; softly leave your compliment at the edge of their space
AGGRESSIVE: speak from your core to their core; note their competence and achievements
RIGID: put it in words; make it factual, specific, and verifiable, with examples
feel and value own inner experience

MERGING: manipulate; cling; collapse; play victim or rescuer
RIGID: get busy; work hard; clean; organize

LEAVING: withdrawal from body and from others; self-damaging acts
MERGING: giving to get; accommodating; pleasing; placating
ENDURING: not acting; self-sabotage; will lash out if pushed beyond endurance
RIGID: find what's wrong and fix it

LEAVING: "You have it. I want it. I'll just imagine I have it."
MERGING: "You have it. I want it. I'll get you to give it to me."
ENDURING: "You have it. I want it. I've failed."
AGGRESSIVE: "You have it. I want it. I'll take it."
RIGID: "You have it. I want it. You should give it to me."

MERGING: generous lover; cuddling feeds infant; merging kills passion
ENDURING: loyal lover, but sex can feel like work; may avoid pleasure
AGGRESSIVE: wants control; fears need and vulnerability
RIGID: becomes a performance; may be mechanical

LEAVING: in universal, nonlinear time; does not orient to linear time
RIGID: experiences time as rigid, mechanical, and predictable

LEAVING: psychic rather than verbal—sends pictures and feelings
MERGING: very verbal, personal, heart to heart; about feelings and melody, not facts and words
ENDURING: slow, reluctant speech; often a partial sentence and a pause; will become confused if you interrupt
AGGRESSIVE: commanding, declarative style; very convincing and compelling, even when wrong
RIGID: preaching, correcting, improving; many words and facts, but few feelings
"It's incorrect or impolite.""It has no rules and order."

column1: Form of attack by Inner Critic

ENDURING: "I can't win." "Life is hard.""I just have to endure it."
RIGID: "All knowledge comes from others." "Love must be earned."

AGGRESSIVE: "Knew I couldn't trust you." "I can handle it."

MERGING: dependent; needy; gives to get; dramatic
AGGRESSIVE: aggressive; wants power; rebellious or authoritarian

LEAVING: may not feel body at all; scared
ENDURING: heavy, thick, solid; stable; internal pressure

MERGING: "I can't." "I'm not enough." Compensated merging: "I will help you."
AGGRESSIVE: "I can and I will." "You're not enough."

LEAVING: fear of physical embodiment and existence
ENDURING: claiming own space, acting and expressing self

LEAVING: right to exist; value of physical existence
MERGING: right to need; right to have
AGGRESSIVE: right to trust others; right to feel safe
RIGID: right to feel; right to trust self

LEAVING: living in human body as an individual, falling apart, going crazy
MERGING: abandonment, rejection, deprivation; not enough of anything
AGGRESSIVE: weakness, domination, betrayal, trusting and letting go
RIGID: chaos and disorder, imperfection, surrender to feelings

MERGING: identifies with needs; Compensated merging: projects needs, identifies as giver
ENDURING: resisting; hiding; self-negation; self-sabotage; passive aggression
AGGRESSIVE: splitting off and denial of needs; active aggression
RIGID: intellectualization; order and correctness; performance; achieving

ENDURING: I'm just trying to please you
AGGRESSIVE: it's all a matter of will

MERGING: I can't; Compensated merging: I can
ENDURING: I don't deserve; leave me alone.

LEAVING: limits contact and incoming energy; leaves body; leaves situation
MERGING: looks to others to fill own needs; Compensated merging: fills others' needs
ENDURING: resists other; turns will against own self; pulls in and hides self deep inside
AGGRESSIVE: rejects needs; idealizes power; uodominates and controls others
RIGID: controls experience; references Rules instead of self; acts appropriately

LEAVING: self is unable to coalesce and anchor in body; weakness in body and ego structure; self shatters easily
MERGING: unable to source, hold, and metabolize own energy; collapses easily
ENDURING: resists everything; can't express self or take own actions; sabotages own actions
AGGRESSIVE: must guard self; unable to need others, trust others, or ask for help
RIGID: unable to feel self and trust inner guidance

LEAVING: thin, may be wiry or waif-like
ENDURING: strong stocky body; heavy hips and thighs

LEAVING: tension in joints; twist in body; jumpy, clumsy
MERGING: sunken chest, head forward; too fat or thin; pale, soft, weak
AGGRESSIVE: attractive, strong upper body; inflated chest
RIGID: high head, closed heart, fast rhythm

LEAVING: tries to function without body or physical core
ENDURING: has core, but feels invaded, so hides
AGGRESSIVE: has core, but constantly guards it

ENDURING: expressing self, taking action, claiming own space

LEAVING: embodiment: claiming the body and physical life
ENDURING: putting out: claiming self and expressing self
AGGRESSIVE: trusting others: feeling held by a good, bigger, stronger presence
RIGID: trusting self: feeling and expressing self

LEAVING: will and strength are not yet online
MERGING: will and strength are not yet online
ENDURING: first personal action taken, but it is thwarted and punished
AGGRESSIVE: succeeds in personal action, but is not limited or contained
RIGID: personal action is divorced from feeling

LEAVING: hostility shattered attention of the incoming spirit
MERGING: unable to take in enough nurturance and love
ENDURING: invaded; humiliated; punished for expressing own autonomy
AGGRESSIVE: during survival fear, no one was there for them; willed self to survive
RIGID: taught to ignore or distrust inner experience and trust only outer rules and forms

LEAVING: self is left fragmented and fragile
MERGING: can't get full; feels needy and empty; fears deprivation
ENDURING: can't control own body/space; fears self-expression and action
AGGRESSIVE: feels powerful, but alone; fears own needs; fears betrayal
RIGID: fears own inner experience; loss of control
